snippet: The militant group continues to make gains, planting bombs in cities and taking over towns, largely unchecked by an army ravaged by what diplomats say are corruption and morale problems.
abstract: Boko Haram fighters snatch dozens of young people from another village in Nigeria, four months after group abducted nearly 300 girls from rural school.

byline.contributor: Ben Ezeamalu contributed reporting from Lagos, Nigeria.

lead_paragraph: The militant group continues to make gains, planting bombs in cities and taking over towns, largely unchecked by an army ravaged by what diplomats say are corruption and morale problems.

headline.main: Condemned but Undeterred, Boko Haram Is Still Abducting Nigerian Youths
headline.print_headline: Condemned but Undeterred, Boko Haram Is Still Abducting Nigerian Youths
